item.title: CodeTogether 4.0—More Goodness for All, Especially Teams
item.dc:creator: Brian Fernandes
item.description:
Now available in CodeTogether 4.0: call & type hierarchies, Teams offering with write access terminals & team-centric UX, single sign-on for On-Premises, and more!

The post CodeTogether 4.0—More Goodness for All, Especially Teams appeared first on Genuitec.

item.title: SDC 2021.02—Updated JREs & JDKs, Big Sur Support & More
item.dc:creator: Brian Fernandes
item.description:
Secure Delivery Center 2021.02 is here with a number of exciting updates. For starters, you’ll get upgraded JREs and JDKs. Also included in this release: optimized memory consumption, the ability to notarize apps for compatibility with macOS Big Sur, and support for self-signed certificates. Read on for the details!

The post SDC 2021.02—Updated JREs & JDKs, Big Sur Support & More appeared first on Genuitec.

item.title: CodeTogether 3.2—Shared Terminals are Here!
item.dc:creator: Brian Fernandes
item.description:
Now available in CodeTogether 3.2: read-only terminal support, better editor colors in Eclipse & IntelliJ, an improved CodeTogether view and more!

The post CodeTogether 3.2—Shared Terminals are Here! appeared first on Genuitec.

item.title: CodeTogether 3.1 with Console Sharing, Access Control & More
item.dc:creator: Brian Fernandes
item.description:
CodeTogether 3.1 is now available with console sharing, access control, non-project file access, on-premises improvements and key fixes.

The post CodeTogether 3.1 with Console Sharing, Access Control & More appeared first on Genuitec.

item.title: CodeTogether 3.0 – Now with IDE to IDE Support and More!
item.dc:creator: Brian Fernandes
item.description:
Now available in CodeTogether 3.0 - heterogeneous IDE to IDE support! Beyond this, we’ve also added the ability to type simultaneously in the same file. Syntax highlighting for several user requested languages as well as a few bug fixes round out this release.

The post CodeTogether 3.0 – Now with IDE to IDE Support and More! appeared first on Genuitec.

item.title: MyEclipse 2020.9.16 is Here with Quarkus, Docker & OpenShift
item.dc:creator: Brian Fernandes
item.description: The post MyEclipse 2020.9.16 is Here with Quarkus, Docker & OpenShift appeared first on Genuitec.

item.title: 10 Steps to a Secure Remote Development Environment
item.dc:creator: eligiom
item.description:
Many companies are transitioning to a remote development environment and security is a major concern. Follow these ten steps for a more secure remote development environment.

The post 10 Steps to a Secure Remote Development Environment appeared first on Genuitec.

item.title: CodeTogether 2.1 is Here with Popular Feature Requests
item.dc:creator: Brian Fernandes
item.description:
CodeTogether 2.1 adds highlighting for additional languages (Elixir, Dart, and COBOL), the ability to upload files to the host, and the ability to choose which resources can be seen. Also, key fixes included one highly recommended for IntelliJ users that use the Coding Alone mode.

The post CodeTogether 2.1 is Here with Popular Feature Requests appeared first on Genuitec.

item.title: CodeMix 2020.7.22 – Angular 10 and Quasar in Eclipse
item.dc:creator: Brian Fernandes
item.description:
CodeMix 2020.7.22 adds support for Angular 10, Quasar (a new Vue.js based framework), and includes key fixes that keep CodeMix running smoothly with the latest versions of Eclipse.

The post CodeMix 2020.7.22 – Angular 10 and Quasar in Eclipse appeared first on Genuitec.

item.title: We Heard You—CodeTogether 2.0 Now with Simultaneous Coding!
item.dc:creator: Brian Fernandes
item.description:
CodeTogether 2.0 provides such a superlative “coolaborative” programming experience, that once you try it, you won’t be able to settle for anything else. There’s a lot coming in this version, from support for additional languages to being able to use your favorite key bindings, and a new shared control framework!

The post We Heard You—CodeTogether 2.0 Now with Simultaneous Coding! appeared first on Genuitec.

item.title: CodeTogether 2.0 Sneak Peek
item.dc:creator: Brian Fernandes
item.description:
CodeTogether 2.0 is coming soon, check out this sneak peek! Simultaneous coding, a more intuitive UI, and an on-premises enterprise solution make this our best release yet. Plus, a host of other enhancements, including the ability to select a preferred IDE theme in the browser, along with your preferred keybindings.

The post CodeTogether 2.0 Sneak Peek appeared first on Genuitec.

item.title: CodeTogether 1.2: End-to-End Secured Remote Pair Programming
item.dc:creator: Brian Fernandes
item.description:
We’re happy to announce the release of CodeTogether 1.2 with some fundamental improvements and key fixes that we’re sure you’ll appreciate … because you asked for them! Over the last few weeks, we’ve seen our user base grow by a few thousand users, many of whom have sent in great feedback that we’ve incorporated into […]

The post CodeTogether 1.2: End-to-End Secured Remote Pair Programming appeared first on Genuitec.

item.title: MyEclipse 2020.5.18 is Here – Java 14, Eclipse 2020-03 and More
item.dc:creator: Brian Fernandes
item.description: The post MyEclipse 2020.5.18 is Here – Java 14, Eclipse 2020-03 and More appeared first on Genuitec.

item.title: CodeTogether 1.1: Now with Seamless Pair Programming for Eclipse, VS Code, and IntelliJ
item.dc:creator: Brian Fernandes
item.description:
CodeTogether 1.1 now available - for pair programming from anywhere! This release includes new features and key fixes. It concludes the early access phase for our Eclipse and VS Code solutions, and introduces early access support for IntelliJ-based IDEs.

The post CodeTogether 1.1: Now with Seamless Pair Programming for Eclipse, VS Code, and IntelliJ appeared first on Genuitec.

item.title: Pair Programming from Anywhere with CodeTogether!
item.dc:creator: Brian Fernandes
item.description:
We are happy to introduce CodeTogether, a great solution for pair programming from anywhere. Currently supports Eclipse, VS Code, and IntelliJ. Download and use CodeTogether now - it's free!

The post Pair Programming from Anywhere with CodeTogether! appeared first on Genuitec.
